data.title: Good things don't need to change
data.text: I have been eating at this restaurant for over 30 years.  My husband and I had our first date here so it has always been special.  It is like going to a family member's home for dinner.  The dishes have remained the same with good reason - no need to mess with perfection.  It is not fancy, is family owned and is absolutely delicious.

data.title: Recommed
data.text:
It took awhile to get menus,but our first impression of this restaurant was that is not fancy, so shouldn't be too expensive and it was family friendly.  We got our salads quickly after we ordered soon after we got the menus.  It took a bit of time to get our ravioli and lasagna, but both were delicious and good portion sizes.

We actually walked there from our Bed and Breakfast, The Lattice Inn which took 20 minutes, but it was pouring rain when we finished.  We asked the woman at the cash register if she could call us a cab.  She tried but none were available.  She talked to a couple who were eating dinner who live in the neighborhood and they offered to give us a ride, which they did.  

This is our first trip to the south and we sure have experienced their gracious hospitality!

data.title: Family but I pay !
data.text: Since 1954. You want authentic Italian from authentic recipes, family and children  friendly, ( they make messes), wine and beer. Family owned, no plastic but no problem !

data.title: Best Italian Food in the AREA
data.text:
I was just introduced to this amazing little place a couple of weeks ago, and I am so impressed that a little Italian joint like this exists in this area !!  BEST ITALIAN FOOD I have found in this whole city !!!

The place is owned and operated by little old Italian women, who are the sweetest things !!  Yes, they only accept cash or check, but it's so worth the stop.  The Italian food is just like you get up North, and most of them are from there.  We have tried the Spaghetti and Meatballs, the Lasagna, Chicken Parm, Ravioli, and salads.  Everything is worth getting, the portions are large, and the price is very reasonable.  I have heard that the pizza is SO GOOD, so I can't wait to try that next time.

data.title: A quiet little gem
data.text: Old School. We were driving through and I wanted Italian. Settled for a pizza and it was great. I have eaten here before and they have great lunch options. I would recommend this place if you want affordable food served by sweet local folks. It is easy to get to off I - 85 just before you get to I - 65.

data.title: Cash or check only
data.text: This place was adorable and the food everyone had looked amazing. Unfortunately it was cash or check only and we only had plastic.

data.title: Atmosphere a throwback to the 60's/70's
data.text: Don't let the outside fool you, the personnel were very friendly aside from the low lighting. Food was good, but not great. The experience was like stepping in a time machine.

data.title: Mama Mia would eat here
data.text: It is about the hand rolled crust on the pizza.The Corsino family has demonstrated the craft of pizza perfection for over forty years. Other Italian delights and Italian ice cream are great. Best place to bring all generations and watch the kids grow up and come back.It is about family,food and outstanding simple Italian food.

data.title: Great neighborhood Italian
data.text: I really loved picking up a to how order and take to my home on S. Perry St. Two blocks away.  It was convenient and consistently good food.  The management and staff were always very helpful and courteous -more like family.  The good wasn't the absolute best Italian I've ever had like in some very high end restaurants around the country, but it was more like a family home made Italian -delicious and like going to an Italian aunts home for diner.  The only issue I've ever had is their hours confused me for some reason.  I don't think they were unusual, but there were some times they'd be closed when I expected them go be open and vice versa.  I'm sure it was my issue and not theirs.   Overall, you can't go wrong with this neighborhood restaurant.  This is one of the places I miss after having moved to Birmingham.

data.title: Good Local American Italian and Pizza.  Go On In.
data.text: Cosino's is a family run Italian restaurant that has been in Montgomery over forty years.  The restaurant has virtually no atmosphere.  Looking at the building from the outside, you probably wouldn't go in, and the inside is not any better.  Corsino's patrons don't care.  The food and the family are the essence of the place.  The restaurant serves simple, American Italian dishes and pizza with several salads and garlic bread, virtually nothing else, at lunch and dinner.  Combos, such as spaghetti and lasagna, are popular, as is the eggplant dish and pizza.  What makes the dishes so good are the authentic cheeses, fresh ingredients, and Don's touch.  When we eat at Corsino's, the hard choice is between an Italian dish and pizza, so, we often order one of each and share them, always with the Dago salad.  Corsino's is not open Saturday or Sunday, so Friday night is their busiest time.  They also do a large takeout business.  I recommend you drive by, go on in despite what you see, and try the food.   I think you'll like it.  If you do be sure to say hello to Myra and Don.
